resources.string: Spell Tap
Welcome to Spell Tap!\n[Tap the screen to continue.]
You\'ve travelled for days, but your journey has just begun. At last, you stand before the world\'s top magic academy: The School of Thought.\n[Tap on a building to enter.]
Tap on the academy.
So you want to be a wizard? And partake in duels of sorcery? Then listen carefully...
Before any spells, you must learn to wield your Knife. Physical violence may be the last resort, but many a wizard owes their life to combat training. I will first teach you to Stab.
Starting from the lower part of the screen, slide your finger up ( ↑ ).
That\'s certainly a Knife! Do it again.
Gesturing on the left half of the screen gives a left-handed Stab, and the right half gives a right-handed Stab.
You show promise. Meet me at the training hall.
Jack awaits you at the training hall.
Stab this wooden dummy 3 times to destroy it. Do the Knife motion (K), then tap the bottom of the screen.
Well done. But let\'s see how you handle hostile targets.
Very funny, though strictly speaking you did destroy the dummy. You\'re lucky I know the Raise Dead spell.
Very funny. You\'re lucky I know the Raise Dead spell. We\'ll move on, even though you lost to a wooden dummy.
Clearly you know how to target your spells, so we\'ll skip a lesson. Train more on the dummy, If you like. Then see me back at school for your first magic lesson.
You must direct your first attacks to the goblins. Make a Knife gesture, then drag your finger from the Stab icon to a goblin.
You learn fast. Come see me at the school for your first magic lesson. Or stay awhile and smash a few more dummies.
You\'re lucky I know the Raise Dead spell. Let\'s try that again.
Palm is a simple but powerful magical gesture.
Drag your finger downwards ( ↓ ) in the lower part of the screen to make the Palm gesture (P).
Good. In a duel, you could cast Shield now.
Great! Shield protects you from all physical attacks.
Take care. Gesturing P with both hands means you surrender! You lose at the end of the round, unless your opponent is dead.
Your first opponent awaits you at the Arena. See me once you\'ve won.
Cast Shield (P) to block stabs.
If you end up in trouble, surrender by gesturing P with both hands.
Good luck! See you after the duel!
The Arena is closed.
Well fought! Let\'s pick up the pace.
Do a Snap gesture (S) by drawing a diagonally up and away from the center, like a Knife gesture that veers outwards (L: ↖ R: ↗ ). Make Snap with both hands and end your turn.
Now, the Digit gesture (D) is the same except you go toward to center (L: ↗ R: ↖ ). Make D with both hands and end the turn.
Surprise! S then D casts Missile. Unlike Shield, most spells take several turns to cast. When you\'re done practicing, come see me.
That\'s not right. Let\'s start again.
At any time, press [MENU] to access your spellbook. It records what you have learned so far.
Missile is useful, but can be blocked by Shield. I\'ll teach you Cause Light Wounds, which deals 2 damage even to shielded targets. Meet me at the Training Hall.
To make a Wave gesture (W), run your finger diagonally downwards and away from the center (L: ↙ R: ↘ ). Wave both hands and end your turn.
Now make the Fingers gesture (F) on both hands: run a finger diagonally downwards and towards the center (L: ↘ R: ↙ ). Then end your turn.
Perfect! Gesture Palm with both hands. Normally this loses, but since WFP is Cause Light Wounds, you\'ll do 4 points of damage and kill your opponent!
One more thing: a gesture can only complete one spell, so you must choose Cause Light Wounds over Shield by tapping its icon.
Well done! Come visit me when you\'re done here.
Almost. Try again.
DSF casts Confusion. If its victim is a spellcaster, they must gesture identically with both hands next turn. If cast on a monster, that monster will attack its controller.
Remember, press [MENU] to review all you have learned. Now head to the Arena, where your next foe awaits.
Recall Shield blocks Stab and Missile.
To deal with Shield, try Cause Light Wounds (WFP). The Confusion spell (DSF) may also help. Good luck!
Impressive! You\'re ready for more spells.
DFW is Cure Light Wounds, which restores up to one point of health.
And SFW is Summon Goblin, which summons a goblin to fight for you.
You encountered two goblins before. Each has 1 point of health and attacks for 1 damage. Use this knowledge wisely.
Best of luck in your next battle!
Oops! You\'ve uncovered a bug!
You win!
You lose...
You both die. It\'s a draw.
Your opponent surrenders. You win!
You surrender...
You both surrender.

Prevents all physical damage: stabs, monster attacks, and missiles.
Fire projectile at target for 1 damage.
Deals 2 damage to target, even if Shield is present.
